harmonic functions

Let Ω={z∈C∣0<∣z∣<1}\Omega = \set{z \in \C \mid 0 < \abs{z} < 1}Ω={z∈C∣0<∣z∣<1}. Prove that for every bounded harmonic function u ⁣:Ω→R\func{u}{\Omega}{\R}u:Ω→R there is a harmonic function v ⁣:Ω→R\func{v}{\Omega}{\R}v:Ω→R obeying

∂u∂x=∂v∂uand∂u∂y=−∂v∂x.\pder{u}{x} = \pder{v}{u} \quad\text{and}\quad \pder{u}{y} = -\pder{v}{x}.∂x∂u​=∂u∂v​and∂y∂u​=−∂x∂v​.
Solution.

Let

h(reiθ)=12π∫02πRe⁡(1+(1/2)eit1−(1/2)eit)u(eit) dth\p{re^{i\theta}} = \frac{1}{2\pi} \int_0^{2\pi} \Re\p{\frac{1 + \p{1/2}e^{it}}{1 - \p{1/2}e^{it}}} u\p{e^{it}} \,\diff{t}h(reiθ)=2π1​∫02π​Re(1−(1/2)eit1+(1/2)eit​)u(eit)dt

be the solution to the Dirichlet problem on the disk B(0,12)B\p{0, \frac{1}{2}}B(0,21​) with boundary condition u∣∣z∣=12\res{u}{\abs{z}=\frac{1}{2}}u∣∣z∣=21​​. Let v(z)=u(z)−h(z)v\p{z} = u\p{z} - h\p{z}v(z)=u(z)−h(z) and observe that v(z)=0v\p{z} = 0v(z)=0 on ∣z∣=12\abs{z} = \frac{1}{2}∣z∣=21​ by construction.

Let ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0 and notice that vε(z)=v(z)+εlog⁡2∣z∣v_\epsilon\p{z} = v\p{z} + \epsilon\log{2\abs{z}}vε​(z)=v(z)+εlog2∣z∣ is harmonic away from 000. Moreover, vε(z)=v(z)=0v_\epsilon\p{z} = v\p{z} = 0vε​(z)=v(z)=0 on ∣z∣=12\abs{z} = \frac{1}{2}∣z∣=21​ by construction. Since vvv is bounded (because uuu is bounded), we also see that

vε(z)→z→0−∞,v_\epsilon\p{z} \xrightarrow{z\to0} -\infty,vε​(z)z→0​−∞,

so there exists r>0r > 0r>0 such that vε(z)≤0v_\epsilon\p{z} \leq 0vε​(z)≤0 when 0<∣z∣≤r0 < \abs{z} \leq r0<∣z∣≤r. Applying the maximum principle to vεv_\epsilonvε​ on the annulus {r<∣z∣<12}\set{r < \abs{z} < \frac{1}{2}}{r<∣z∣<21​}, it follows that vε(z)≤0v_\epsilon\p{z} \leq 0vε​(z)≤0 on the entire punctured disk.

Sending ε→0\epsilon \to 0ε→0, we see that u(z)≤h(z)u\p{z} \leq h\p{z}u(z)≤h(z) on the punctured disk also. Running the same argument with vvv replaced with h−uh - uh−u instead, we see that h(z)≤u(z)h\p{z} \leq u\p{z}h(z)≤u(z) on the punctured disk as well, and so u(z)=h(z)u\p{z} = h\p{z}u(z)=h(z) except at the origin. In other words, uuu extends harmonically to the entire disk, which is simply connected, so uuu admits a harmonic conjugate.
